artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Matsui Eikichi; Carver: Takimoto Chokuzan
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 477; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 211, p. 291.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: two sheets configured vertically; man hanging on top green, grey and yellow dragon at the top point of a pitched roof on a red building with black trim and black roof tiles; man at top wears blue blouse and purple pants, and has sword extended downward, held in his PR hand; man on flatter portion of roof in foreground holding a short staff in his teeth, with legs wide apart, retying a white belt over a kimono with yellow dragon and multicolored clouds on a green ground with yellow tassels on trim; grey birds flying to right of roof between two men
dimension: 15 1/4 × 10 1/4 in. (38.74 × 26.04 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban, upright diptych)
markings: Artist’s seal: 大蘇 {Taiso} | Carver’s seal: 直山刀 {Chokuzan tō}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Untitled series of upright diptychs
title: Two Brave Men Battling on the Roof of Hōryūkaku
